issue.title: FW: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing
issue.body:
*Sent by @jesse-WSDOT (AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
I really do, thanks for reminder!!!

**From:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 31, 2022 11:40 AM  
**To:** Mejia, Glen  <[MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hey Glen, 

I wanted to reachout to see if you still wanted to chat about GPS devices. I’m around most of the week. 

Jesse 

**From:** Mejia, Glen  <[MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, October 19, 2022 4:19 PM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>; Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant) <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** FW: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hello Jesse,

I’m stepping in here to see if I can help our group with testing some GPS options. I’m the new biology lead for NWR and just getting up to speed on our gear. I’ve worked with an R1 before, and it was pretty straightforward, but did have trouble sometimes syncing with the tablet or phone and know they can be finnicky. Let setup a meeting to chat before we start field testing equipment.

Cheers,

Glen Mejia

NWR Biology Lead

WSDOT Northwest Region

Mobile: 503-962-9007

Email: [MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.   
**Sent:** Tuesday, October 18, 2022 9:21 PM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:AltonJe@WSDOT.WA.GOV)>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <[SavageS@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:SavageS@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:MerriSA@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV)>  
**Subject:** RE: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hey Jesse!

I’m sorry but I don’t know what a “use case” means!

Sam – would it be helpful to give the R1 or R2 a spin on an upcoming field visit? Accuracy is a good question. Likely not “survey grade.”

You all are super helpful, and have great questions, and I think I’m going to ask for some help in sorting out our program needs, it’s something we need a few people to weigh in on. I’ll follow up shortly…

Thanks!  
Ruth

**From:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Tuesday, October 18, 2022 4:08 PM  
**To:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hey Ruth, 

Before I get too far into the weed, what you’re use case? 

Yes! We can check out equipment to the Regions. However, our HQ ESO folks do have first priority. 

I have an R2 and R1 for you to demo if you’re interested. These units are both sub-foot. Do you need survey-grade(cm) accuracy? We can talk offline if that’s the case. 

As for software – you’ll want to use ArcGIS Collector or ArcGIS FieldMaps (usually on a WSDOT iPad). This requires as WSDOT AGOL account. You can use work and personal phones with these apps. 

It’s a good solution is you plan to manage and view data in ArcMap. 

We also offer Trimble TerraSync on a ToughPad for offline workflows. However – this requires additional post processing on my end. 

We do have a few older Trimble Geo6000s and a Geo7 with TerraSync SW and ArcPad. These are handheld devices. 

Feel free to give me a call this week if you what to discuss what the best software and hardware option would be for your program. 

Jesse Alton

GIS & Data Project Manager 

Environmental Information Program 

**WSDOT - Environmental Services Office**

C: 360-480-9356

Email GIS Requests to: [wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov)

Email Drone Flight Requests to: [esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 1:44 PM  
**To:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>; Alton, Jesse <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** Re: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

This is super helpful. Thanks a bunch, Steve. 

Jesse, is checking equipment out still an option? I think that might be a tad cumbersome for our needs. But I know we have to have equipment care and feeding folks otherwise. 

Sam/Steve, what do you see the benefit as making this investment would provide? No need for the survey crew to pick up our points? Anything else?

Thanks!

Ruth

Get [Outlook for iOS](https://aka.ms/o0ukef)

* * *

**From:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 1:25 PM  
**To:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>; Alton, Jesse <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Ruth – 

Addressing the toughbooks first, I would say they are not really optimized for the type of work we would do in the field. They would act more like a desktop solution and there aren’t really any commercial-off-the-shelf solutions that would work well for the investment we’d need to put into them. The fieldwork we would do really is optimized for tablets or phones that run an iOS or Android operating system, so an iPad/iPhone/Android phone/Android tablet really would be the optimal solution for our workflow.

There are a couple of options that can pair with an iOS or Android device being used for Field Maps GIS fieldwork:

  * Beacon on a belt/palm sized Bluetooth GNSS


    * Trimble R1 ~ $3,000
    * EOS Arrow 100 ~ $3,000
    * iSXBlue II ~ $2,900


  * Traditional GPS antenna Bluetooth GNSS (would need secondary purchase of at least a pole/field staff to screw antenna onto)


    * Trimble R2 ~ $3,300


      * Accessory pole ~ $150



There is a need for an App on each device (meaning admin password if WSDOT device, no issue with own device) to pair with the GNSS device and that will in turn be useable by the Field Maps GIS app in the field. 

One note worth mentioning, when my GIS team was supporting more regular fieldwork on the 405 megaprogram, we worked with Jesse Alton ([altonje@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:altonje@wsdot.wa.gov)) at WSDOT to check-out and use existing WSDOT-owned Trimble R1 or R2 devices from HQ (I believe) with all of the cables to charge and properly setup the devices. Jesse may not be the exact right person, but as WSDOT owns these devices already, investigating the use of them with Jesse may be better before purchase. Not sure Jesse sits in the same team, I last worked with Jesse 2 years ago, but Jesse should have the info we need or the person to contact to work this out. 

I have cc’ed Jesse here. Thank you Ruth.

  
Steve

****

**Steve Savage**

I-405/SR 167 Environmental Team

425.450.2717 | [savages@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:savages@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 10:55 AM  
**To:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** FW: ESO tablet transfer to NWR biologists - INC000000882550

Hey Steve and Sam,

I’m hoping you all can help with a little research on GPS antennae recommendations + costs.

It sounds like folks are mostly using their phones to collect data, but Sam mentioned an antennae could be helpful. Do you know what sort of antennae would work? And the cost? Does it work on android and apple?

Also we have Panasonic toughpads in our inventory, see chain below. Folks haven’t found them to be very useful, and they also aren’t GPS connected. Are you familiar with these devices, Steve? Can we add an antennae? Would it be different than what we’d need for the phone?

Thanks!!

Ruth

issue.title: FW: R2 Quote Upgrade
issue.body:
*Sent by @jesse-WSDOT (AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Purchase Quote->>

Jesse,

We can certainly do the no cost license transfer for “TerraSync -> TerraFlex” and “Pathfinder to Trimble Positions” if you have your licenses current and at the latest software version. The TerraFlex cloud/direct workflow is fully compatible with iOS and Android workflow at this stage, you will be able to post process your data on your PC (Windows 11) with no problem.

The Trimble DA2 workflow is fully supported by iOS, personally have been using this combo over an year and it has not failed me. Very similar to the R2, the DA2 uses real time configuration, compatible with TerraFlex cloud/direct workflow. However, the DA2 workflow is attached to a subscription workflow which could be a little bit annoying to manage if you have a large amount of users, and you don’t have to use WSRN with this workflow. In terms of accuracy, it outstands all other mapping grade equipment when you work under heavy canopies, this includes the Geo7x workflow.

I also attached a quote on the R2 centimeter upgrade in this email, state contract discount applied. Feel free to let me know if you have any questions!

Thank you,

**Subject:** RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Trimble Supported Workflows - WSDOT 

Hey Sara, 

Just for the record, I do have two R2s (one CM) and Trimble Positions for ArcGISDesktop. 

I’m interested in the TerraSync > TerraFlex “no cost trade in”. 

I’ll have to continue to use PFO and TerraSync for the next few years, but wanted to slowly move some my TerraSync licenses to TerraFlex and TerraOffice for future workflows with our R2 units. Just thinking about my option moving off TerraSync. My only issue is that TerraFlex and TerraOffice have to work on IOS and possible WINDOWS11. 

Also – I’d like to maybe upgrade my decimeter R2 to CM. Can you send me a quote for that?? 

Also – Any info on the DA2 Catalyst system for IOS. 

Cheers, 

Jesse 

Jesse Alton

GIS & Data Project Manager 

Environmental Information Program 

**WSDOT - Environmental Services Office**

C: 360-480-9356

Email GIS Requests to: [wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov)

Email Drone Flight Requests to: [esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Sara Lau  <[sara@frontierprecision.com](mailto:sara@frontierprecision.com)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 3, 2022 7:42 AM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** [EXTERNAL] RE: Trimble Supported Workflows - WSDOT 

**WARNING:** This email originated from outside of WSDOT. Please use caution with links and attachments. 

Hi Jesse,

The TerraFlex Direct and TerraFlex cloud workflows are designed for the newer GNSS devices, this includes the TDC650 and the Trimble DA2 and R2. Both equipment uses real time configuration but you can also post process your real time data if they are not very ideal in the field. The TerraFlex Direct workflow is required to have a TerraFlex subscription and a Trimble Positions license. We can convert your Pathfinder Office license to Trimble Position with zero cost if your Pathfinder license is current at v5.9. 

Moving forward with these two workflows will require newer equipment than just the Geo7x, I’m more than happy to get you more information on these modern GNSS devices, feel free to let me know if you have any questions!

Thank you,

**Sara Lau** | Geospatial Sales Representative

12658 Interurban Ave S, Seattle, WA 98168

issue.title: No DCC
issue.body:
*Sent by Nick Mallalieu (nick.mallalieu@btinternet.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi, I have just built an EX-Command station using a genuine Arduino UNO and genuine Arduino Motor Shield.  I have a 12V 5 amp power supply to the shield and am powering the UNO via the laptop computer which is running Windows 11 and  an Edge browser.

I am not getting DCC power from either the A or B connection although if I run command <1> on the Arduino Serial Monitor window all 4 lights come on and the voltage checks out at 12.5 AC on the A outputs.  As soon as I reset the Motor Board and the lights are not on there is no power again from output A.

I have checked Baud rate is 115200 and have set both CR & NL.

EX-Installer runs OK once I allowed the Firewall to let it!

I have been using the “TRY IT” EX-WebThrottle via the USB and that is configured as per the instructions.

I am a bit stumped can you please help?

Nick

issue.title: Sponsored Post
issue.body:
*Sent by Martin (martin@contentmar.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi,

I hope this email finds you well.

I am sending this email to ask if you are interested in sponsored posts.We are searching for relevant sites and blogs for our clients.

You will get 100% top notch content with 1 do follow link relevant to your site niche.

Please let me know how much do you charge per post?

We will pay you through Paypal or Payoneer gateway as soon our article is published.

Looking forward to building long-term business opportunities with you.

Best Regards,
Martin

issue.title: RFQ - The Insights Shop - HIV Tracking Study (P. Goldfinger) - Netherlands
issue.body:
*Sent by  (thomas@tis-research.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi There,

I hope you are well!

We are from The Insights Shop (TIS) and we have a new HIV Tracking Study for Netherlands market with below details:

Market: Netherlands

TOTAL N= 10 HIV Specialists to complete: 

  * _Online pre work task ahead of the Web-based telephone interviews_



 _20 minute survey – TIS to provide links_

  *  _Web-based telephone interviews (TDIs)_



 _45 minute interviews_

Once we have approval recruitment and fieldwork can run simultaneously. We aim to complete all interviews within a 6 week period – we expect we would have approval to start towards the end of October.

Kindly let us know your feasibility & CPI for this study at earliest. 

Looking forward to hearing back from you

Thanking you,

 ** _Thomas Raymond_**

 _Project Manager_

issue.title: Package GIS layers to share with consultants
issue.body:
*Sent by @kechinn (chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Coordinate with Declan Weingart and Victoria Book.

~Keisha

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 1:02 PM  
**To:** Chinn, Keisha  <chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Subject:** FW: GIS Task

Hey Keisha,

I am trying to develop a GIS file to share with consultants, and I was wondering if you could help me get a GIS file package that would work well for that?

Thanks,

Declan Weingart

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 12:57 PM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Thanks Declan. 

Thinking it would be good to have the GIS files to share with the team. 

Can you ask Keisha Chin to help you get a GIS file package that we can send to the consultants. 

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 12:05 PM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

I have attached the map with the ariel imagery. 

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 10:31 AM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Great. 

Can you turn on the ariel photo so we can see where they are in relation to land marks. 

The mitigation site is the blue hatch? And the conservation area the green? 

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 10:03 AM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Yeah, I just need to zoom in more. I found an environmental Mitigation Site and attached a screenshot of the details as well as a resource conservation area. 

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 9:51 AM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

What are the blue dots within the right of way?? 

You should be able to click on that and get details. Might need to zoom in and change the color or line size.

![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/36dc8312-c0c1-4db8-8271-75035a29cfb5/image001.png)

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 9:38 AM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

I made sure all the layers I could find relating to Banks and mitigation sites where turned on as well as the resource conservation areas. I have attached a picture of the exported map. 

I didn’t see much mitigation sites close to the project area or resource conservation areas. 

Let me know if you want something different!

Thanks,

Declan

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 7:50 AM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Can you export the map and send it to me. 

Check wetland mitigation sites (in addition to banks) – I think there should be a layer for that!

Also, resource conservation areas. 

Thanks! 

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, October 26, 2022 2:59 PM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

The closest wetland mitigation site is the Chehalis Basin Wetland Mitigation Bank. I didn’t see any resource conservation areas nearby. I have attached the arc GIS map I used to look this up. 

<https://ecology.wa.gov/Water-Shorelines/Wetlands/Mitigation/Wetland-mitigation-banking/Mitigation-bank-projects/Chehalis-Basin>

Let me know if you want me to look up more information. 

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, October 26, 2022 2:04 PM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** GIS Task

Declan, 

Do you have access to GIS? 

If yes, can you look up Resource conservation area and wetland mitigation sites in the Nisqually Delta Area of I-5. This general area. 

![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/36dc8312-c0c1-4db8-8271-75035a29cfb5/image002.png)

_Victoria Book_ _(she/her)_

Assistant Olympic Region Environmental Manager __

Telework phone / mobile (360) 870 – 8446

[victoria.book@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:victoria.book@wsdot.wa.gov)

~~Office (360) 570 – 6707~~

issue.body:
*Sent by Google Scholar Alerts (scholaralerts-noreply@google.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

### 

### 

### [PDF] [Factors affecting the availability of data on East African wildlife: the monitoring needs of conservationists are not being met](https://scholar.google.be/scholar_url?url=https://www.speciesmonitoring.org/uploads/8/4/9/7/84975128/moreno_et_al_in_press_biodiversity___conservation.pdf&hl=en&sa=X&d=3587775297851844285&ei=NkpZY8GRHOSN6rQP54usmA0&scisig=AAGBfm24siVdWfkJqSc_5LNmHM67Avnpcw&oi=scholaralrt&hist=4xzX38sAAAAJ:14924640029845333812:AAGBfm1ASPlw0svDhJYVW3vT56RySoGsNw&html=&pos=0&folt=kw)

I Morenoa, JMW Gippetd, L Fumagallia…

Understanding the status and abundance of species is essential for effective   
conservation decisionmaking. However, the availability of species data varies   
across space, taxonomic groups and data types. A case study was therefore …

issue.title: FW: [EXTERNAL] RE: Washington 24-hour precipitation maps
issue.body:
*Sent by WSDOT ESO GIS (WSDOTESOGIS@WSDOT.WA.GOV). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
**From:** Chinn, Keisha  <chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, December 7, 2022 9:26 AM  
**To:** WSDOT ESO GIS  <WSDOTESOGIS@WSDOT.WA.GOV>  
**Subject:** Fwd: [EXTERNAL] RE: Washington 24-hour precipitation maps

-Keisha

* * *

**From:** Page, Simon  <[PageSi@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:PageSi@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Sent:** Wednesday, December 7, 2022 9:13:08 AM  
**To:** Nguyen, Alex  <[NguyeAl@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:NguyeAl@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Chinn, Keisha  <[chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Johnson, Tanya <[JohnsTa@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:JohnsTa@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Washington 24-hour precipitation maps

They are on the GIS workbench, I do not know where they files are stored to ship them out easily as a package. Maybe Keisha or Tanya can point you to the files. We could always just load up the files to a map and then export the data to a folder and zip it up.

**Simon Page**

**HYDROLOGIST**

**WSDOT**

[Simon.Page@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:Simon.Page@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Nguyen, Alex  <[NguyeAl@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:NguyeAl@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, December 7, 2022 6:43 AM  
**To:** Page, Simon  <[PageSi@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:PageSi@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** FW: [EXTERNAL] RE: Washington 24-hour precipitation maps

Hi Simon,

Do you know how to find and send the GIS files for the Washington isopluvial and MAP maps WSDOT uses? I’m not well versed in GIS so I’m looking for someone to help with this request. Thanks!

Alex

**From:** Casey Kramer  <[ckramer@naturalwaters.design](mailto:ckramer@naturalwaters.design)>   
**Sent:** Monday, December 5, 2022 5:06 PM  
**To:** Nguyen, Alex  <[NguyeAl@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:NguyeAl@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Crowley, Josha  <[Josha.Crowley@atkinsglobal.com](mailto:Josha.Crowley@atkinsglobal.com)>  
**Subject:** [EXTERNAL] RE: Washington 24-hour precipitation maps

**WARNING:** This email originated from outside of WSDOT. Please use caution with links and attachments. 

Hi Alex,

Hope all is well! 

I am hoping you could assist Josha and Ana with FEMA on their request. They are looking to get GIS files for the Washington isopluvial and MAP maps WSDOT uses, which were developed by MGS. I remember these being on the WSDOT workbench and I think the server, but it has been awhile. 

Any assistance you can provide would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,

Casey 

**From:** Crowley, Josha  <[Josha.Crowley@atkinsglobal.com](mailto:Josha.Crowley@atkinsglobal.com)>   
**Sent:** Monday, December 5, 2022 2:10 PM  
**To:** Casey Kramer  <[ckramer@naturalwaters.design](mailto:ckramer@naturalwaters.design)>  
**Subject:** FW: Washington 24-hour precipitation maps

Casey – Ana Simoes in my office is looking for this dataset. She did not get an answer from Julie. Do you know anything about its availability?

Josha Crowley, PE, PMP, CFM, D.WRE

RSC Lead | STARR II - Region 10 Service Center

Phone: (425) 329-3679

Cell: (206) 499-2440

**From:** Simoes, Ana P   
**Sent:** Tuesday, October 4, 2022 11:39 PM  
**To:** 'Julie.Heilman@wsdot.wa.gov'  <[Julie.Heilman@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:Julie.Heilman@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** FW: Washington 24-hour precipitation maps

Hello Julie,

You may remember me, I work with Josha Crowley and presented at NORFMA right before you and Casey – it was very nice meeting you there. 

I would like to follow up with you regarding the WA isopluvial maps and the availability of grided datasets, if our group could have access to those. As I mentioned to you, I had reached out to Garrett but he probably never got my message (below) as I haven’t heard from him so far. 

As I say below, any help is very much appreciated. Thanks,

Ana.

****

**Ana Paula Sim�es, PhD, PH, CFM**

Sr. Hydrologist | STARR II - FEMA Region X Service Center

![A screenshot of a video game

Description automatically generated with medium confidence](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/2fb20ede-bb55-4f7c-b203-2a82fd9b636e/image001.png)

20700 44th Avenue West, Suite 130, Lynnwood, WA, 98036 | Tel: +1 (425) 329-3695 |

Email: [ana.simoes@atkinsglobal.com](mailto:ana.simoes@atkinsglobal.com) | Web: [www.starr-team.com](http://www.starr-team.com/)

**From:** Simoes, Ana P   
**Sent:** Thursday, September 1, 2022 2:50 PM  
**To:** [Garrett.Jackson@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:Garrett.Jackson@wsdot.wa.gov)  
**Subject:** Washington 24-hour precipitation maps

Dear Garrett,

I work as a contractor to FEMA Region X, providing technical support to floodplain mapping projects in Washington, Oregon, Idaho and Alaska. In that capacity, I and other collaborators have consulted the WSDOT Washington precipitation-frequency maps in PDF format a few times. Is there a GIS dataset, shapefile, available with the same information? I have checked WSDOT’s and MGS’s websites but couldn’t find anything. That information would be particularly helpful for countywide mapping studies. 

Any help is greatly appreciated. Best regards,

Ana.

Ana Paula Sim�es _PhD, PH, CFM_   
Senior Hydrologist  
  
---  
  
Water Resources

Engineering Services

issue.title: Hello beloved
issue.body:
*Sent by Marian Smuts (info@oaaa.gov.om). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hello Beloved

�I am a 61 years old Woman diagnosed with Esophageal Cancer immediately after the death of my husband. My name is Mrs. Marian Smuts, an American citizen, a widow and a devoted Christian. I found your contact during my research for a business opportunity. I am looking forward to partnering with you which I think will be beneficial to both of us.

I have been touched by God to donate what I have inherited from my late husband to you, to set up a foundation in my late husband's name, help the motherless and less privilege, rather than allow my relatives to use my husband hard earned funds ungodly, since we had no kids to inherit the fund,

As soon as I receive your reply I shall give you more details and the contact of the Bank where the fund was deposited, and Instruct my attorney to prepare the inheritance papers regarding the fund.

Hoping to hear from you soon

Yours in Christ,

Mrs. Marian Smuts

issue.title: "Biodiversity beyond national jurisdiction" - new results
issue.body:
*Sent by Google Scholar Alerts (scholaralerts-noreply@google.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
###

issue.title: FW: New ArcGIS Online Accounts
issue.body:
*Sent by @jesse-WSDOT (AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
**From:** Starks, Garrett  <StarksG@wsdot.wa.gov>   
**Sent:** Tuesday, December 6, 2022 10:04 AM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Subject:** RE: New ArcGIS Online Accounts

Thanks Jesse. 

The web map is internal, mostly for discussion purposes with those involved in the retrofit planning, and it will probably drastically change or be replaced in the next 3 to 6 months as we identify what we really need. 

I’m not sure which web map environment we need. I just added you to the group with the web map so you can check it out [ https://wsdot.maps.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=ad85090154784594bfc177e4c0c581eb](https://wsdot.maps.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=ad85090154784594bfc177e4c0c581eb). It is rough. I added layers that were already available online, and then published the remaining environmental workbench data I needed from ArcMap. I’ll need to publish from ArcMap occasionally. The reason I’m using the web map is because the load time for everything in ArcMap was so slow that our team couldn’t use it during discussions or meetings, so the web map is serving as a place to quickly view things. Sheena and Tony need accounts so they can use and edit the map on their own. 

Hope that info helps… I hack my way through GIS so I don’t often have the right terminology haha.

-Thanks

**From:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Tuesday, December 6, 2022 8:40 AM  
**To:** Starks, Garrett  <[StarksG@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:StarksG@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: New ArcGIS Online Accounts

I'd be happy to help you. Before we get too far into the weeds – do you know if this web map is internal only or will it be something you share with the public?

At WSDOT we have two different ESRI web map environments. Which I think you know about. Do you know if you want to use the Portal application or is this specific to AGOL. 

With Portal and AGOL is pretty easy to get setup – I just need to put a request in to Stacey Plumley. 

With AGOL we need to determine what type of account you need. Do you want to create/publish new data from PRO/ArcMap to AGOL or Portal?

<https://hqolymgisprtl1p.wsdot.loc/portal/home/>

[WSDOT Online Map Center (arcgis.com)](https://wsdot.maps.arcgis.com/home/index.html)

Jesse

Jesse Alton

GIS & Data Project Manager 

Environmental Information Program 

**WSDOT - Environmental Services Office**

C: 360-480-9356

Email GIS Requests to: [wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov)

Email Drone Flight Requests to: [esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Starks, Garrett  <[StarksG@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:StarksG@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Tuesday, December 6, 2022 8:09 AM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** New ArcGIS Online Accounts

Hey Jesse,

Hope you’re doing well and having a good holiday season. I’m looking to get Tony Bush and Sheena Pietzold set up with ArcGIS online accounts so we can work on a web map for retrofit prioritization. Can you help me with that or point me to someone who can? Thanks!

Garrett Starks

Assistant Municipal Stormwater Permit Coordinator 

Environmental Services Office

Washington State Department of Transportation

360.470.3724

issue.title: FW: GIS Workbench
issue.body:
*Sent by @kechinn (chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
**From:** Wiltse, Wayne  <WiltseW@wsdot.wa.gov>   
**Sent:** Monday, December 5, 2022 9:31 AM  
**To:** Chinn, Keisha  <chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Subject:** GIS Workbench

Good Morning Keisha,

Carl Ward recommended you would be a great contact person regarding ArcGIS. Who should I reach out to in assisting me setting up my ArcGIS workbench. Specifically, I will need the Tribal U&A and Tribal Area of interest layers. 

Thank You,

Wayne Wiltse

**Wayne Wiltse**

Fish Passage Tribal Liaison

WSDOT Olympic Region 

Environmental & Hydraulics Services Office

7407 31st Ave NE | Lacey, WA 98516

## Sherry created a ticket 

Name: Sherry Kulhanek

Email: sakulhanek@gmail.com

Timezone: -6

Software: EX-CommandStation

Version: 4.0.x

Title: Engine does not run.

Description: I’m a ‘conductor’ who followed the instructions for creating the EX-CommandStation and running the EX-Installer and EX-WebThrottle programs. Before connecting the Arduino Motor Shield Rev 3 to the Elegoo Mega 2560, I snipped the vin pin on the motor shield. I have the EX-CommandStation connected to a Windows 11 laptop with the USB cable. I ran EX-Installer. My entries in the Installer window were similar to Figure 20. I set up the WIFI configuration to connect to my home WIFI Network (Station Mode). I checked the WIFI box and entered the WIFI SSID and password. There was no place to enter the host name, server port or IP address. There was a box to enter the WIFI channel. I checked the WIFI properties on the laptop and found the WIFI channel (149) and entered it. I did a compile and upload. I downloaded the EX-WebThrottle App. I tested the setup and everything seemed to check out – until I tried to run the locomotive. The track has power and the DCC engine works fine on another track. The Mega 2560 has power and the Motor Shield’s four light are on. Is there a way to check that the EX-CommandStation is connecting to my home WIFI network? I’ve attached the debug console from EX-WebThrottle – from connecting to DCC, turning power on, acquiring a loco, trying to run the loco and turn on its headlight. I would appreciate any assistance. Thank you in advance for your help. 

_Remaining email Quota: 99_

1. [web_throttle_debug_console.rtf](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/77de49fb-b37a-4b26-9056-ed6d08a818d9/web_throttle_debug_console.rtf)

Stenhouse …](https://scholar.google.com/scholar_url?url=https://www.nyftwg.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/EW-Avian-and-Bat-PCM-framework_160922_V6.pdf&hl=en&sa=X&d=17917237278381162143&ei=A3WBY5_4FJqM6rQPmI6jiAg&scisig=AAGBfm1-BksQERDus8cc6sUtkXOv1ap8GA&oi=scholaralrt&hist=4xzX38sAAAAJ:8232670458149073384:AAGBfm3iKcoWDV_FfAZ9RQfeoyi3MmYP_A&html=&pos=0&folt=kw)

Title: Ethernet mac address

issue.title: FW: water quality map services
issue.body:
*Sent by @jesse-WSDOT (AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Jesse Alton

GIS & Data Project Manager 

Environmental Information Program 

**WSDOT - Environmental Services Office**

C: 360-480-9356

Email GIS Requests to: [wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov)

Email Drone Flight Requests to: [esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Plumley, Stacey  <PlumlS@wsdot.wa.gov>   
**Sent:** Monday, November 14, 2022 11:05 AM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Cc:** Mitchell, Jordyn  <MitcheJo@wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Subject:** RE: water quality map services

Hi Jesse,

I’ve attached the latest APRX for the environmental mapping map service. Jordyn has requested that I repoint the water quality layers to the new feature classes, but I’d like ESO to do it instead, because of the following:

The WaterQuality.DBO.WatQual303dImpairedWaters no longer has ‘4B’ for CategoryCode so the basin plans layer will no longer display.

![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/a25db6db-6758-40e0-832c-ea1d8297e94e/image002.png)

The hq annual reporting TMDLs layer has the following definition query. I’m not sure if this is still valid.

![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/a25db6db-6758-40e0-832c-ea1d8297e94e/image003.png)

Please update and send the APRX back to me.

Thanks!

Stacey

**From:** Mitchell, Jordyn  <[MitcheJo@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MitcheJo@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Tuesday, November 8, 2022 3:49 PM  
**To:** Plumley, Stacey  <[PlumlS@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:PlumlS@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** water quality map services

Hi Stacey,

Enviro made a change to the water quality data, and two featureclasses have been superceded by two new versions.

Since there was a schema change, (the name) I did this by adding the new data to SDE, and have not deleted the old data yet so at the moment, map services are not broken.

I need you to repoint map services that are using the old version of the data to use the new ones, then I can retire the old data.

Here is what changed, in the water

WaterQuality.DBO. **WaterQualityAssessment305bCurrent** is replaced by WaterQuality.DBO. **WatQual303dImpairedWaters**

WaterQuality.DBO. **WaterQualityTMDLBoundariesECY** is replaced by WaterQuality.DBO. **WatQualTMDLBoundariesECY**

Thank you - Jordyn




---
*Attachments:*

1. [EnvironmentalMapping.aprx](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/a25db6db-6758-40e0-832c-ea1d8297e94e/EnvironmentalMapping.aprx)

issue.title: Cost to place an article on dcc-ex.com?
issue.body:
*Sent by Adam Ready (adam@i-gamingmedia.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi there, 

Can you please let me know about pricing and guidelines for placing an article on [dcc-ex.com](http://dcc-ex.com).

The site seems like a great fit for a key client campaign I'm working on, and our in-house writers can create a high-quality article based on your audience to make sure it's a great fit for you too!

As we have several other top clients looking to enhance their brand via editorial content in this niche, we can likely bring further opportunities your way later down the line if you're open to it.

See here two examples of recent pieces we have done:

Dear Customer,

A shipment has been arranged for you through TNT

Attached is the documentation that relates to this Express Import Order  
Print and sign all copies of the consignment note.

  
Note: For shipments outside of the EU, it is highly recommended to include the actual invoice of the goods. 

\- Make sure you have read the TNT Terms & Conditions attached to this email. By signing the consignment notes, you confirm that you agree to the TNT Terms & Conditions. 

\- Hand the signed copies of the consignment note to the TNT Express driver, keep the Sender copy for your records. 

\- Leave the shipment open for TNT Express driver to inspect. 

As your order has been processed automatically, it is not necessary to contact TNT Express Customer Service by telephone.

  
If you would like to find out about the many ways TNT helps you to track your shipment, or if you would like to know more about the services provided by TNT, simply connect to [www.tnt.com](http://www.tnt.com/) and select your location at any time.

If you are not the intended recipient, please telephone or email the sender and delete this message and any attachment from your system.

issue.title: FW: [EXTERNAL] Data request
issue.body:
*Sent by @kechinn (chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
New GIS request from Declan. See below

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov>   
**Sent:** Monday, November 14, 2022 1:33 PM  
**To:** Chinn, Keisha  <chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Subject:** FW: [EXTERNAL] Data request

Hey Keisha,

I have been requested to get another GIS data package for the consultants. They are requesting the data of **Statewide_2021_6in** or any other higher **orthophoto (3 inches per pixel** ). 

Would you be able to assist with packaging this data so I can send it to them?

Let me know if that request makes sense or if you need additional information. 

Thanks,

Declan Weingart

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, November 14, 2022 1:24 PM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Carle, Ashley  <[CarleAs@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:CarleAs@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Sharese Graham <[sharese.graham@scjalliance.com](mailto:sharese.graham@scjalliance.com)>; Jenifer Young <[JYoung@parametrix.com](mailto:JYoung@parametrix.com)>  
**Subject:** RE: [EXTERNAL] Data request

Declan,

Can you work with HQ to get this data set packaged and send to Jennifer. 

Thx! 

**From:** Jenifer Young  <[JYoung@parametrix.com](mailto:JYoung@parametrix.com)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, November 9, 2022 12:33 PM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Carle, Ashley  <[CarleAs@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:CarleAs@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Sharese Graham <[sharese.graham@scjalliance.com](mailto:sharese.graham@scjalliance.com)>  
**Subject:** [EXTERNAL] Data request

**WARNING:** This email originated from outside of WSDOT. Please use caution with links and attachments. 

Hi Victoria,

I shared the email with the mitigation site and resource conservation area information. Our GIS lead noticed another dataset that we’d like to request access to: a statewide 2021 6in dataset that is linked to [ https://imagery-state.watech.wa.gov/arcgis/services/ImageServices/Statewide_2021_6in_4band_wsps_83h_img/ImageServer](https://imagery-state.watech.wa.gov/arcgis/services/ImageServices/Statewide_2021_6in_4band_wsps_83h_img/ImageServer)

Could we please have that data ( **Statewide_2021_6in** ) and/or any other higher **orthophoto (3 inches per pixel** ) you have available? 

Thank you! Please let me know if you have any questions. 

| 

![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/d18d96b4-c847-43cd-9265-0cba204e2ce9/image001.png)  
  
---  
  
**Jenifer Young**

Environmental Planning & Compliance Division Manager  
  
[206-394-3716](tel:206-394-3716) | direct

issue.title: Re: No DCC
issue.body:
*Sent by Nick Mallalieu (nick.mallalieu@btinternet.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi Fred,

  


Having a few issues going through contacting via the Discord Server, so apologies for coming back to you directly but could you help please?

  


So I have built my EX-Command station using a genuine Arduino UNO and genuine Arduino Motor Shield. I have a 12V 5 amp power supply to the shield and am powering the UNO via the laptop computer which is running Windows 11 and an Edge browser.  
  
AS per your last email I have a WiFi shield coming to me from China and will order a Mega Clone. The UNO is working ok using a JRMI throttle, couldn’t download the Ex-Eb throttle and the web version hasn’t got an F1 key for sound.

  


My many question is when I set up my new WiFi enabled Mega do I need another board with a sensor shield for automation and running sensors and servos either linked to the EX- Command Station or plugged into the computer via a separate USB port and Comms Port? The web page on the subject seems to suggest you can do it all from the Command Station board but then wouldn’t it be difficult to connect up PCA9685s and sensors?

  


thanks,

  
Nick

  


> On 3 Nov 2022, at 15:50, Nick Mallalieu <[nick.mallalieu@btinternet.com](mailto:nick.mallalieu@btinternet.com)> wrote:
> 
>   
> 
> 
> Hi, I have just built an EX-Command station using a genuine Arduino UNO and genuine Arduino Motor Shield. I have a 12V 5 amp power supply to the shield and am powering the UNO via the laptop computer which is running Windows 11 and an Edge browser.  
>   
> I am not getting DCC power from either the A or B connection although if I run command <1> on the Arduino Serial Monitor window all 4 lights come on and the voltage checks out at 12.5 AC on the A outputs. As soon as I reset the Motor Board and the lights are not on there is no power again from output A.  
>   
> I have checked Baud rate is 115200 and have set both CR & NL.  
>   
> EX-Installer runs OK once I allowed the Firewall to let it!  
>   
> I have been using the “TRY IT” EX-WebThrottle via the USB and that is configured as per the instructions.  
>   
> I am a bit stumped can you please help?  
>   
> Nick

issue.title: Ticket Submitted via Website
issue.body:
*Sent by  (dccextended@gmail.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
## Nick created a ticket 

Name: Nick Mallalieu

Email: nick.mallalieu@btinternet.com

Timezone: 0

Software: EX-CommandStation

Version: 4.0.x

Title: Automation

Description: Thanks to Fred I have successfully set up an UNO and JMRI throttle to operate a test track (couldnt download EX-Web Throttle or operate Fi on web). Next step is to build a Mega version with WiFi as suggested by Fred and then try some basic "to and Fro" automation. Looking ahead to this it appears that I would connect the sensors etc directly to the new Mega Command Station as per the web site. Is this correct or should I have a seperate MEGA with a Sensor board to connect the sensors and servos connected to a different COMs port than the EX-CommandStation?

 _Remaining email Quota: 100_

issue.title: FW: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing
issue.body:
*Sent by @jesse-WSDOT (AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
I really do, thanks for reminder!!!

**From:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 31, 2022 11:40 AM  
**To:** Mejia, Glen  <[MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hey Glen, 

I wanted to reachout to see if you still wanted to chat about GPS devices. I’m around most of the week. 

Jesse 

**From:** Mejia, Glen  <[MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, October 19, 2022 4:19 PM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>; Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant) <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** FW: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hello Jesse,

I’m stepping in here to see if I can help our group with testing some GPS options. I’m the new biology lead for NWR and just getting up to speed on our gear. I’ve worked with an R1 before, and it was pretty straightforward, but did have trouble sometimes syncing with the tablet or phone and know they can be finnicky. Let setup a meeting to chat before we start field testing equipment.

Cheers,

Glen Mejia

NWR Biology Lead

WSDOT Northwest Region

Mobile: 503-962-9007

Email: [MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.   
**Sent:** Tuesday, October 18, 2022 9:21 PM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:AltonJe@WSDOT.WA.GOV)>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <[SavageS@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:SavageS@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:MerriSA@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV)>  
**Subject:** RE: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hey Jesse!

I’m sorry but I don’t know what a “use case” means!

Sam – would it be helpful to give the R1 or R2 a spin on an upcoming field visit? Accuracy is a good question. Likely not “survey grade.”

You all are super helpful, and have great questions, and I think I’m going to ask for some help in sorting out our program needs, it’s something we need a few people to weigh in on. I’ll follow up shortly…

Thanks!  
Ruth

**From:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Tuesday, October 18, 2022 4:08 PM  
**To:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hey Ruth, 

Before I get too far into the weed, what you’re use case? 

Yes! We can check out equipment to the Regions. However, our HQ ESO folks do have first priority. 

I have an R2 and R1 for you to demo if you’re interested. These units are both sub-foot. Do you need survey-grade(cm) accuracy? We can talk offline if that’s the case. 

As for software – you’ll want to use ArcGIS Collector or ArcGIS FieldMaps (usually on a WSDOT iPad). This requires as WSDOT AGOL account. You can use work and personal phones with these apps. 

It’s a good solution is you plan to manage and view data in ArcMap. 

We also offer Trimble TerraSync on a ToughPad for offline workflows. However – this requires additional post processing on my end. 

We do have a few older Trimble Geo6000s and a Geo7 with TerraSync SW and ArcPad. These are handheld devices. 

Feel free to give me a call this week if you what to discuss what the best software and hardware option would be for your program. 

Jesse Alton

GIS & Data Project Manager 

Environmental Information Program 

**WSDOT - Environmental Services Office**

C: 360-480-9356

Email GIS Requests to: [wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov)

Email Drone Flight Requests to: [esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 1:44 PM  
**To:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>; Alton, Jesse <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** Re: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

This is super helpful. Thanks a bunch, Steve. 

Jesse, is checking equipment out still an option? I think that might be a tad cumbersome for our needs. But I know we have to have equipment care and feeding folks otherwise. 

Sam/Steve, what do you see the benefit as making this investment would provide? No need for the survey crew to pick up our points? Anything else?

Thanks!

Ruth

Get [Outlook for iOS](https://aka.ms/o0ukef)

* * *

**From:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 1:25 PM  
**To:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>; Alton, Jesse <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Ruth – 

Addressing the toughbooks first, I would say they are not really optimized for the type of work we would do in the field. They would act more like a desktop solution and there aren’t really any commercial-off-the-shelf solutions that would work well for the investment we’d need to put into them. The fieldwork we would do really is optimized for tablets or phones that run an iOS or Android operating system, so an iPad/iPhone/Android phone/Android tablet really would be the optimal solution for our workflow.

There are a couple of options that can pair with an iOS or Android device being used for Field Maps GIS fieldwork:

  * Beacon on a belt/palm sized Bluetooth GNSS


    * Trimble R1 ~ $3,000
    * EOS Arrow 100 ~ $3,000
    * iSXBlue II ~ $2,900


  * Traditional GPS antenna Bluetooth GNSS (would need secondary purchase of at least a pole/field staff to screw antenna onto)


    * Trimble R2 ~ $3,300


      * Accessory pole ~ $150



There is a need for an App on each device (meaning admin password if WSDOT device, no issue with own device) to pair with the GNSS device and that will in turn be useable by the Field Maps GIS app in the field. 

One note worth mentioning, when my GIS team was supporting more regular fieldwork on the 405 megaprogram, we worked with Jesse Alton ([altonje@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:altonje@wsdot.wa.gov)) at WSDOT to check-out and use existing WSDOT-owned Trimble R1 or R2 devices from HQ (I believe) with all of the cables to charge and properly setup the devices. Jesse may not be the exact right person, but as WSDOT owns these devices already, investigating the use of them with Jesse may be better before purchase. Not sure Jesse sits in the same team, I last worked with Jesse 2 years ago, but Jesse should have the info we need or the person to contact to work this out. 

I have cc’ed Jesse here. Thank you Ruth.

  
Steve

****

**Steve Savage**

I-405/SR 167 Environmental Team

425.450.2717 | [savages@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:savages@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 10:55 AM  
**To:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** FW: ESO tablet transfer to NWR biologists - INC000000882550

Hey Steve and Sam,

I’m hoping you all can help with a little research on GPS antennae recommendations + costs.

It sounds like folks are mostly using their phones to collect data, but Sam mentioned an antennae could be helpful. Do you know what sort of antennae would work? And the cost? Does it work on android and apple?

Also we have Panasonic toughpads in our inventory, see chain below. Folks haven’t found them to be very useful, and they also aren’t GPS connected. Are you familiar with these devices, Steve? Can we add an antennae? Would it be different than what we’d need for the phone?

Thanks!!

Ruth

issue.title: FW: R2 Quote Upgrade
issue.body:
*Sent by @jesse-WSDOT (AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Purchase Quote->>

Jesse,

We can certainly do the no cost license transfer for “TerraSync -> TerraFlex” and “Pathfinder to Trimble Positions” if you have your licenses current and at the latest software version. The TerraFlex cloud/direct workflow is fully compatible with iOS and Android workflow at this stage, you will be able to post process your data on your PC (Windows 11) with no problem.

The Trimble DA2 workflow is fully supported by iOS, personally have been using this combo over an year and it has not failed me. Very similar to the R2, the DA2 uses real time configuration, compatible with TerraFlex cloud/direct workflow. However, the DA2 workflow is attached to a subscription workflow which could be a little bit annoying to manage if you have a large amount of users, and you don’t have to use WSRN with this workflow. In terms of accuracy, it outstands all other mapping grade equipment when you work under heavy canopies, this includes the Geo7x workflow.

I also attached a quote on the R2 centimeter upgrade in this email, state contract discount applied. Feel free to let me know if you have any questions!

Thank you,

**Subject:** RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Trimble Supported Workflows - WSDOT 

Hey Sara, 

Just for the record, I do have two R2s (one CM) and Trimble Positions for ArcGISDesktop. 

I’m interested in the TerraSync > TerraFlex “no cost trade in”. 

I’ll have to continue to use PFO and TerraSync for the next few years, but wanted to slowly move some my TerraSync licenses to TerraFlex and TerraOffice for future workflows with our R2 units. Just thinking about my option moving off TerraSync. My only issue is that TerraFlex and TerraOffice have to work on IOS and possible WINDOWS11. 

Also – I’d like to maybe upgrade my decimeter R2 to CM. Can you send me a quote for that?? 

Also – Any info on the DA2 Catalyst system for IOS. 

Cheers, 

Jesse 

Jesse Alton

GIS & Data Project Manager 

Environmental Information Program 

**WSDOT - Environmental Services Office**

C: 360-480-9356

Email GIS Requests to: [wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov)

Email Drone Flight Requests to: [esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Sara Lau  <[sara@frontierprecision.com](mailto:sara@frontierprecision.com)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 3, 2022 7:42 AM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** [EXTERNAL] RE: Trimble Supported Workflows - WSDOT 

**WARNING:** This email originated from outside of WSDOT. Please use caution with links and attachments. 

Hi Jesse,

The TerraFlex Direct and TerraFlex cloud workflows are designed for the newer GNSS devices, this includes the TDC650 and the Trimble DA2 and R2. Both equipment uses real time configuration but you can also post process your real time data if they are not very ideal in the field. The TerraFlex Direct workflow is required to have a TerraFlex subscription and a Trimble Positions license. We can convert your Pathfinder Office license to Trimble Position with zero cost if your Pathfinder license is current at v5.9. 

Moving forward with these two workflows will require newer equipment than just the Geo7x, I’m more than happy to get you more information on these modern GNSS devices, feel free to let me know if you have any questions!

Thank you,

**Sara Lau** | Geospatial Sales Representative

12658 Interurban Ave S, Seattle, WA 98168

issue.title: No DCC
issue.body:
*Sent by Nick Mallalieu (nick.mallalieu@btinternet.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi, I have just built an EX-Command station using a genuine Arduino UNO and genuine Arduino Motor Shield.  I have a 12V 5 amp power supply to the shield and am powering the UNO via the laptop computer which is running Windows 11 and  an Edge browser.

I am not getting DCC power from either the A or B connection although if I run command <1> on the Arduino Serial Monitor window all 4 lights come on and the voltage checks out at 12.5 AC on the A outputs.  As soon as I reset the Motor Board and the lights are not on there is no power again from output A.

I have checked Baud rate is 115200 and have set both CR & NL.

EX-Installer runs OK once I allowed the Firewall to let it!

I have been using the “TRY IT” EX-WebThrottle via the USB and that is configured as per the instructions.

I am a bit stumped can you please help?

Nick

issue.title: Sponsored Post
issue.body:
*Sent by Martin (martin@contentmar.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi,

I hope this email finds you well.

I am sending this email to ask if you are interested in sponsored posts.We are searching for relevant sites and blogs for our clients.

You will get 100% top notch content with 1 do follow link relevant to your site niche.

Please let me know how much do you charge per post?

We will pay you through Paypal or Payoneer gateway as soon our article is published.

Looking forward to building long-term business opportunities with you.

Best Regards,
Martin

issue.title: RFQ - The Insights Shop - HIV Tracking Study (P. Goldfinger) - Netherlands
issue.body:
*Sent by  (thomas@tis-research.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi There,

I hope you are well!

We are from The Insights Shop (TIS) and we have a new HIV Tracking Study for Netherlands market with below details:

Market: Netherlands

TOTAL N= 10 HIV Specialists to complete: 

  * _Online pre work task ahead of the Web-based telephone interviews_



 _20 minute survey – TIS to provide links_

  *  _Web-based telephone interviews (TDIs)_



 _45 minute interviews_

Once we have approval recruitment and fieldwork can run simultaneously. We aim to complete all interviews within a 6 week period – we expect we would have approval to start towards the end of October.

Kindly let us know your feasibility & CPI for this study at earliest. 

Looking forward to hearing back from you

Thanking you,

 ** _Thomas Raymond_**

 _Project Manager_

issue.title: Package GIS layers to share with consultants
issue.body:
*Sent by @kechinn (chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Coordinate with Declan Weingart and Victoria Book.

~Keisha

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 1:02 PM  
**To:** Chinn, Keisha  <chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Subject:** FW: GIS Task

Hey Keisha,

I am trying to develop a GIS file to share with consultants, and I was wondering if you could help me get a GIS file package that would work well for that?

Thanks,

Declan Weingart

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 12:57 PM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Thanks Declan. 

Thinking it would be good to have the GIS files to share with the team. 

Can you ask Keisha Chin to help you get a GIS file package that we can send to the consultants. 

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 12:05 PM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

I have attached the map with the ariel imagery. 

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 10:31 AM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Great. 

Can you turn on the ariel photo so we can see where they are in relation to land marks. 

The mitigation site is the blue hatch? And the conservation area the green? 

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 10:03 AM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Yeah, I just need to zoom in more. I found an environmental Mitigation Site and attached a screenshot of the details as well as a resource conservation area. 

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 9:51 AM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

What are the blue dots within the right of way?? 

You should be able to click on that and get details. Might need to zoom in and change the color or line size.

![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/36dc8312-c0c1-4db8-8271-75035a29cfb5/image001.png)

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 9:38 AM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

I made sure all the layers I could find relating to Banks and mitigation sites where turned on as well as the resource conservation areas. I have attached a picture of the exported map. 

I didn’t see much mitigation sites close to the project area or resource conservation areas. 

Let me know if you want something different!

Thanks,

Declan

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 7:50 AM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Can you export the map and send it to me. 

Check wetland mitigation sites (in addition to banks) – I think there should be a layer for that!

Also, resource conservation areas. 

Thanks! 

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, October 26, 2022 2:59 PM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

The closest wetland mitigation site is the Chehalis Basin Wetland Mitigation Bank. I didn’t see any resource conservation areas nearby. I have attached the arc GIS map I used to look this up. 

<https://ecology.wa.gov/Water-Shorelines/Wetlands/Mitigation/Wetland-mitigation-banking/Mitigation-bank-projects/Chehalis-Basin>

Let me know if you want me to look up more information. 

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, October 26, 2022 2:04 PM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** GIS Task

Declan, 

Do you have access to GIS? 

If yes, can you look up Resource conservation area and wetland mitigation sites in the Nisqually Delta Area of I-5. This general area. 

![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/36dc8312-c0c1-4db8-8271-75035a29cfb5/image002.png)

_Victoria Book_ _(she/her)_

Assistant Olympic Region Environmental Manager __

Telework phone / mobile (360) 870 – 8446

[victoria.book@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:victoria.book@wsdot.wa.gov)

~~Office (360) 570 – 6707~~

issue.body:
*Sent by Google Scholar Alerts (scholaralerts-noreply@google.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

### 

### 

### [PDF] [Factors affecting the availability of data on East African wildlife: the monitoring needs of conservationists are not being met](https://scholar.google.be/scholar_url?url=https://www.speciesmonitoring.org/uploads/8/4/9/7/84975128/moreno_et_al_in_press_biodiversity___conservation.pdf&hl=en&sa=X&d=3587775297851844285&ei=NkpZY8GRHOSN6rQP54usmA0&scisig=AAGBfm24siVdWfkJqSc_5LNmHM67Avnpcw&oi=scholaralrt&hist=4xzX38sAAAAJ:14924640029845333812:AAGBfm1ASPlw0svDhJYVW3vT56RySoGsNw&html=&pos=0&folt=kw)

I Morenoa, JMW Gippetd, L Fumagallia…

Understanding the status and abundance of species is essential for effective
